article.body: Forget the balloon-drops, backslapping and cheering crowds: This yearâs Democratic National Convention, beginning Monday, will be an almost entirely virtual event, as the party faithful gather around computer screens and TVs to celebrate Joe Biden as their presidential nominee. Originally scheduled as an in-person event in Milwaukee, the convention has instead changed to something resembling a four-day Zoom ZM, +2.89% Â meeting thanks to the coronavirus pandemic. Biden will accept the nomination on Thursday from his home state of Delaware, and speakers including vice-presidential pick Kamala Harris and party stars like Bill Clinton and Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will be addressing fellow Democrats via video instead of onstage in Wisconsin.
